raw_infobox.career_number: 23, 12,{{efn|Jordan wore a nameless No. 12 jersey in a February 14, 1990, game against the Orlando Magic because his No. 23 jersey had been stolen.Strauss, Chris (December 12, 2012). [https://www.usatoday.com/story/gameon/2012/12/12/nba-jordan-bulls-12/1763265/ "The greatest No. 12 that no one is talking about"]. {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221008123352/https://www.usatoday.com/story/gameon/2012/12/12/nba-jordan-bulls-12/1763265/ |date=October 8, 2022 }}. ''USA Today''. Retrieved October 30, 2023.}} 45
raw_infobox.highlights:
* 6× NBA champion (1991–1993, 1996–1998)
* 6× NBA Finals MVP (1991–1993, 1996–1998)
* 5× NBA Most Valuable Player (1987, 1990, 1991, 1995, 1997)
* 14× NBA All-Star (1985–1993, 1996–1998, 2002, 2003)
* 3× NBA All-Star Game MVP (1988, 1996, 1998)
* 10× All-NBA First Team (1986–1992, 1995–1997)
* All-NBA Second Team (1984)
* NBA Defensive Player of the Year (1987)
* 9× NBA All-Defensive First Team (1987–1992, 1995–1997)
* NBA Rookie of the Year (1984)
* NBA All-Rookie First Team (1984)
* 10× NBA scoring champion (1986–1992, 1995–1997)
* 3× List of National Basketball Association annual steals leaders (1987, 1989, 1992)
* 2× NBA Slam Dunk Contest champion (1987, 1988)
* {{abbr|No.|Number}} 23 Chicago Bulls#Retired numbers and honorees
* {{abbr|No.|Number}} 23 Miami Heat#Retired numbers
* 3× AP Athlete of the Year (1990–1992)
* Sports Illustrated Sportsperson of the Year (1991)
* NBA anniversary team (50 Greatest Players in NBA History, NBA 75th Anniversary Team)
* List of NCAA Division I men's basketball champions (1982 NCAA Division I men's basketball tournament)
* Consensus List of U.S. men's college basketball national player of the year awards (1983–84 NCAA Division I men's basketball season)
* 2× Sporting News Men's College Basketball Player of the Year (1983, 1984)
* 2× Consensus first-team NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans (1983 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans, 1984 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans)
* Atlantic Coast Conference Men's Basketball Player of the Year (1984)
* ACC Athlete of the Year (1984)
* 2× First-team List of All-Atlantic Coast Conference men's basketball teams (1983, 1984)
* Atlantic Coast Conference Men's Basketball Rookie of the Year (1982)
* No. 23 North Carolina Tar Heels men's basketball retired numbers
* 3× USA Basketball Male Athlete of the Year (1983, 1984, 1992{{Efn|As part of the 1992 Olympic team}})
* McDonald's All-American Game (1981 McDonald's All-American Boys Game)
* First-team Parade All-America Boys Basketball Team (1981)
* Presidential Medal of Freedom (2016)

personal_info.high_school: Emsley A. Laney High School(Wilmington, North Carolina)
